1.title: The Caddie, Bubba Watson and Brandon Dunes
1.plot: A profile of Henrik Stenson's caddy Gareth Lord, the panel casts an eye over Bubba Watson, and a there is a visit to Bandon Dunes, a remote clutch of courses on the Oregon shore.

2.title: The TV Producer, Justin Rose and Bethpage Black
2.plot: Behind the scenes of televised golf, a look at how hard work leads to success for Justin Rose, and the Cinderella story of the Black Course at New York's Bethpage State Park.

3.title: The Collector, Shane Lowry and TPC Sawgrass
3.plot: A profile of Bobby Jones, the panel discusses Shane Lowry, and Deane Beman explains how he and Pete Dye created the Stadium Course at Sawgrass.

4.title: The Agent, Martin Kaymer and Old Head Golf Links
4.plot: How Chubby Chandler went from player to a leading agent, the coaches show how Martin Kaymer organises his way to success and there is a report from the Old Head Golf Links, Kinsale.

5.title: The Sponsor, Jordan Spieth and Verdura
5.plot: Aberdeen Asset Management's Martin Gilbert explains how golf works for the sponsor, Jordan Spieth goes under the panel's microscope, and there is a report from Verdura in Sicily.

6.title: The Legend, Bernhard Langer and Trump International
6.plot: Professional Mike Wright keeps the Hogan flame alight in Texas, the panel explain why Bernhard Langer has been so good for so long, and Donald Trump introduces his new course in Scotland.

7.title: The Tournament Director, Hedrick Stenson and Grand Saint-Emilion Golf Club
7.plot: The European Tour's David Probyn explains how the organisation manages to put on a tournament almost every week of the year. Plus, the expert panel looks at Henrik Stenson's game.

8.title: The Pro, Luke Donald and the World Golf Hall of Fame
8.plot: Lee Slattery details how far hard work and dedication will get a golfer on the Tour, the experts analyse Luke Donald's game, and there is a report on the World Golf Hall of Fame.

9.title: The Chief Executive, Charley Hull and Golf in Ghana
9.plot: An interview with R&A chief executive Martin Slumbers, a look at why Charley Hull is an exciting talent, and Paul McGinley discusses his part in putting Ghana on the golfing map.

10.title: The Physio, Jason Day and Sandy Lane
10.plot: A look at how mobile physio units help keep players in trim, the experts talk about what Jason Day and his swing may need. Plus, a report on Sandy Lane in Barbados.

11.title: The Journalist, Danny Willett and Pete and Alice Dye
11.plot: The experts look at the game of 2016 Masters winner Danny Willett, cameras follow journalist John Hopkins, and there is a look at the work of course designers Pete and Alice Dye.

12.title: The Club Pro, Michelle Wie and Barnbougle Dunes
12.plot: The programme pays tribute to the club professional, one of golf's unsung heroes. Plus, the panel of experts looks at how Michelle Wie plays the game.

13.title: The Photographer, Dustin Johnson and La Manga
13.plot: Photographer Anthony Edgeworth illustrates how a camera and golf's playing fields can be combined to great effect. Plus, the experts discuss athleticism in Dustin Johnson's game.

14.title: The Historian, Matt Fitzpatrick and The Concession Golf Course
14.plot: Photographer Anthony Edgeworth illustrates how a camera and golf's playing fields can be combined to great effect. Plus, the experts discuss athleticism in Dustin Johnson's game.

15.title: The Greenkeeper, Rickie Fowler and National Golf Links of America
15.plot: Cameras follows Sawgrass course superintendent Jeff Plotts, the experts run the rule over the swing of Rickie Fowler and there is a visit to the National Golf Links of America.

16.title: The Trucks, Rory McIlroy and the Melbourne Sandbelt
16.plot: A report on travelling workshops that accompany big-time golf, revealing how clubs and balls matter just as much as the players. Plus, the experts look at the game of Rory McIlroy.
